page.title: 05ENERGY - OIL IN EAKRING
page.content: The present BP offices stand on the land which together with associated farmland, land in Duke's, Redgate and Pudding Poke Woods was purchased during the sale of the Rufford Abbey Estate in 1934/35 by the D'Arcy Exploration Co. Geophysical survey undertaken in 1937 and an anticline with its culmination under Eakring was discovered. The larger Duke's Wood field was discovered later. Between 1939-1946 197 wells were drilled, with production of around 2,000 barrels a day. Production was phased out during the 1960's and 105 wells abandoned; abandonment of the remainder commenced in 1982. Activities are now expanding with personnel around 300. Eakring is the HQ of BP's Land Division, which oversees all onshore operations in Britain, with new offices planned.
